means: 遏制[阻止]（液体的流动等）( stem的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Our ship stemmed on against the current.
The concern about this axiom stemmed from the fact.
sentence.Network_cn: 对于这个公理的考虑是基于这样的事实.

sentence.Network_en: From this source there stemmed major new branches of mathematics.
sentence.Network_cn: 由此起源产生了数学的一些主要新分支.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 《Friends》词汇表B ... events eventsn. 事件 stemmed adj. 有茎的, 去掉茎的 mulch n. 覆盖, 覆盖物.
去梗叶(stemmed)——烟叶包括叶片或碎叶的梗或中脉已被去除后的状态。 叶片(strips)——指一片已去梗的烟叶，或指由许多叶片组 …
《Friends》词汇表B ... events eventsn. 事件 stemmed adj. 有茎的, 去掉茎的 mulch n. 覆盖, 覆盖物.
In some countries that secrecy stemmed from the military uses of nuclear fission ., 某些国家 , 那种秘密是基于将核裂变用军事用途.

list.abs: 干细胞（stem cell）（Stem cell）即起源细胞，是一类具有自我更新和分化潜能的细胞。在细胞的分化过程中，细胞往往由于高度分化而完全失去 …
血液细胞是由骨髓里的造血干细胞（Stem cells）不断地繁殖与分化制造出来。所谓「血液干细胞」即是指具有繁殖与分化能力的造 …
波纹管截止阀_百度百科 ... 定位片 locator 阀杆螺母 stem nut 手轮 hand wheel.
脑干(brain stem)上接大脑、背靠小脑、尾侧与脊髓相连、前侧依次分为中脑、脑桥、延髓。小脑和脑干所夹空间称为第四脑室。

entry.tran: (与形容词连用构成新的形容词)表示“有…茎的”，“有…柄的”
entry.def: -stemmed is added to adjectives to form adjectives which indicate what the stem of something is like.

means.word_mean: 1. having a stem or stems or having a stem as specified; often used in combination;
2. producing a well-developed stem above ground

auth_sentence.content: This attack stemmed from cyber gangs in Eastern Europe.

auth_sentence.content: Long- and short-stemmed flowers alike had snagged on the drapes.

auth_sentence.content: Instead, she sipped from a stemmed glass.
